pull.title: tests: add a test-security target and run it in CI
pull.body: [Wladimir asked](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/18415#issuecomment-603843094) about running the `test-security-check.py` script in our CI. This PR adds a target for that: `make test-security` and adds it to a few CI jobs.

events.body:

We run the symbol and security checks in gitian, but not the security-check test.

verification.payload:
tree 819379771f8e45169abf97c32be97829f5b9f90b

tests: run test-security-check.py in CI

tree 2a6de3b9ecde53efa32ba062db957a42690d2645
parent 968aaae940b064f21eddee6bb461aa08f777544c
author fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1589511140 +0800
committer fanquake <fanquake@gmail.com> 1592308350 +0800

test: use subprocess.run() in test-security-check.py

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -21,7 +21,7 @@ def write_testcode(filename):
 
 def call_security_check(cc, source, executable, options):
     subprocess.check_call([cc,source,'-o',executable] + options)
-    p = subprocess.Popen(['./security-check.py',executable], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, universal_newlines=True)
+    p = subprocess.Popen(['../contrib/devtools/security-check.py',executable], stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, stdin=subprocess.PIPE, universal_newlines=True)
comments.body: This will break when the distdir is more than one folder deep. I'd prefer if the script was linked like everything else (test_runner.py, etc)

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,6 +10,7 @@ export CONTAINER_NAME=ci_native_tsan
 export DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:16.04
 export PACKAGES="clang llvm python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libqrencode-dev"
 export NO_DEPENDS=1
+export RUN_SECURITY_TESTS=false
comments.body:
Instead of setting it to false in every config file, why not set it to false by default and only explicitly set it to true in the one config that needs it?

If every config has to specify the value, it sort of defeats the purpose of the default value.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -10,6 +10,7 @@ export CONTAINER_NAME=ci_native_tsan
 export DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:16.04
 export PACKAGES="clang llvm python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libqrencode-dev"
 export NO_DEPENDS=1
+export RUN_SECURITY_TESTS=false

@@ -342,3 +342,14 @@ clean-local: clean-docs
 	rm -rf coverage_percent.txt test_bitcoin.coverage/ total.coverage/ fuzz.coverage/ test/tmp/ cache/ $(OSX_APP)
 	rm -rf test/functional/__pycache__ test/functional/test_framework/__pycache__ test/cache share/rpcauth/__pycache__
 	rm -rf osx_volname dist/ dpi36.background.tiff dpi72.background.tiff
+
+test-security:
comments.body: Maybe `test-security-check` target instead of `test-security`? I mean, it's a test for the binary security check. It doesn't check the security of the actual binaries.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -342,3 +342,14 @@ clean-local: clean-docs
 	rm -rf coverage_percent.txt test_bitcoin.coverage/ total.coverage/ fuzz.coverage/ test/tmp/ cache/ $(OSX_APP)
 	rm -rf test/functional/__pycache__ test/functional/test_framework/__pycache__ test/cache share/rpcauth/__pycache__
 	rm -rf osx_volname dist/ dpi36.background.tiff dpi72.background.tiff
+
+test-security:
comments.body: Sure. I've updated the target to `test-security-check`.
